medical: PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Painful ingrown toenail, left big toe. POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Painful ingrown toenail, left big toe. OPERATION: Removal of an ingrown part of the left big toenail with excision of the nail matrix. DESCRIPTION OF PROCEDURE: After obtaining informed consent, the patient was taken to the minor OR room and intravenous sedation with morphine and Versed was performed and the toe was blocked with 1% Xylocaine after having been prepped and draped in the usual fashion. The ingrown part of the toenail was freed from its bed and removed, then a flap of skin had been made in the area of the matrix supplying the particular part of the toenail. The matrix was excised down to the bone and then the skin flap was placed over it. Hemostasis had been achieved with a cautery. A tubular dressing was performed to provide a bulky dressing. The patient tolerated the procedure well. Estimated blood loss was negligible. The patient was sent back to Same Day Surgery for recovery.
layman:
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Painful ingrown toenail on the left big toe.  
POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Painful ingrown toenail on the left big toe.  

OPERATION: The ingrown part of the left big toenail was removed and the part of the nail that grows it (the nail matrix) was cut away.  

DESCRIPTION OF PROCEDURE: After the patient gave permission, she was taken to a small‑surgery room. She was given a sedative (morphine and Versed) and the toe was numbed with 1% Xylocaine. The area was cleaned and covered in the usual way. The ingrown part of the toenail was freed from the skin and removed. A small piece of skin was cut near the nail matrix. The matrix was cut back to the bone, and the skin piece was placed over the area. Bleeding was stopped with a cautery. A tube‑shaped dressing was applied to keep the area protected. The patient tolerated the procedure well. Blood loss was negligible. She was sent back to the same‑day surgery recovery area.
